channel.title: Help with a little script

item.title: Help with a little script
item.dc:creator: @m0u53m4t m0u53m4t
item.description:
@m0u53m4t wrote:

Just use InvFull instead. For example:

[scar]procedure choptree;
begin
repeat
begin
//findtree
//clicktree
end
until(invfull)
end;
[/scar]

You may also want to use dtms for the tree instead of just a color.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a little script
item.dc:creator: @meanz meanz
item.description:
@meanz wrote:

procedure FindTree1;
var px,py: integer;
begin
if(FindColorSpiral(px,py,Tcl1,4,4,514,337))then
begin
MMouse(px,py,1,1);
if(IsTextAt2(9,9,‘Chop down Willow’,100))then
begin
Mouse(px,py,0,0,true);
wait(2000);
repeat
wait(1000);
MMouse(710,443,0,0);
if(IsTextAt2(9,9,‘Use’,100))then
begin
Writeln(‘Works’);
//Bank;
end;
MMouse(px,py,0,0);
until(not(IsTextAt2(9,9,‘Chop down Willow’,100)))
end;
end;
end;
//End of tree finding1

okay what i am doing is choping the willow, and while i am doing that i am checking if i got full inv.

  wait(1000);
  MMouse(710,443,0,0);
  if(IsTextAt2(9,9,'Use',100))then
  begin
  Writeln('Works');
  //Bank;
  end;
  MMouse(px,py,0,0);

here is the checking part it should work but it doesnt it checks last slot in inv and then not writes the works word… why is that?

Read full topic
